title: So why is Lux on Fiora's "rivals" list? Seems like more than just a noble family rivalry...
body:
If Fiora treated Lux as a rival simply for being a Crownguard, wouldn't she consider Garen a rival too? Since she doesn't, I'm guessing there's something else to it.

My guess? Lux had some part to play in how Fiora's father was exposed as a fraud, and Fiora blames Lux (partially) for the shaming of her family's name as a result.

Anyone want to chip in to this thought?

replies.body:
{{champion:114}} I know what you did that day. I know how you put my family honor in ruins.
{{champion:99}} What are you talking about? What happened was your fathers fault, and how could it be I who ruined him?
{{champion:114}} How can you just sit behind you dainty face as you spout bullshit! You used your magic to expose my father for who he is!
{{champion:99}} (Begins to sob lightly) He was the one I cheered for in duels. I looked up to him as I did my brother. Seeing him...
{{champion:114}} I do not care for the petty apologies you give me. You put me in ruin and I will never forget this!
{{champion:99}} (Is crouched to the ground with her arm covering her face) I.. I... I illuminated to everyone what he had done... I couldn't stand my hero being so...
{{champion:114}} As I said, I do not care for your apologies, and neither do I care for your excuses. You put me in this filth and I will have climb my way back up!

I guess you could say..... Fiora struck a vital.

_walks out_

I think it might be that she envy Lux. Lux is gifted, born with a talent, and magic came to her naturally where as  Fiora who train hard to prove herself might resent/feel that Lux never really work for any of it. An example would be like from Naruto, Sasuke born talented and very skillful where as Naruto who was the the weakling who had to bust his ass to reach the other person level. Or at least this is how I see it.
Certainly possible, but I don't think Fiora's all that interested in magic.
